title: Collaborative Science Learning Design Strategies in Computer Laboratory Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic physics/chemistry theories and possession of fundamental experimental skills
context.additional_context: A science retraining course for working professionals, emphasizing digital experiment design skills applicable to job tasks

learning_goals: Learners identify ≥3 expert thinking patterns (problem decomposition, pattern recognition, analogical reasoning, etc.) in collaborative problem-solving processes using virtual lab tools (e.g., simulation software), derive ≥2 solution strategies with team members, and write a report meeting ≥4 of 5 evaluation checklist items
Development of project management skills to design and execute team-based scientific inquiry in CSCL environments.
Fostering the ability to perform peer feedback and knowledge sharing based on analysis of digital lab data.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
